goals.description: Steal stored project artefacts such as market analyses, financial models, and founder bios to sell to competitors or use for corporate espionage.
Manipulate tool calls so the system embeds malicious macros or external scripts in generated PPTX decks, turning them into malware delivery vectors.
Overload the platform with massive, repeated pitch‑deck generation requests, exhausting compute resources and making the service unavailable to legitimate users.
Extract the internal system prompts and instruction templates that guide the LLM, enabling attackers to recreate or subvert the model's behavior elsewhere.
Bypass safety filters to force the LLM to produce deceptive or copyrighted content, such as plagiarized slides or fabricated market data that would normally be blocked.
Coerce the LLM into performing unauthorized web searches that scrape competitor websites or private databases, harvesting proprietary information.
Harvest user email addresses and payment details embedded in project metadata, then exfiltrate them for phishing or credential stuffing campaigns.
